Job Description
Lays out and fits pipe and/or structural components for fabrication and repair in accordance with established drawings and welding procedures.
Lays out and prepare base metals using air and power tools.
 Reads and properly interprets blue prints and drawings.
Demonstrates knowledge of gas line safety and fire prevention.
Able to run hot work notifications, post hot work chits and set up work site.
Fabricate and template new assemblies utilizing SMAW, FCAW, GTAW or BRAZE.
Knowledgeable in Navy WAF and Tag Out systems; able to develop, submit, and / or close out WAFS, to include verification and concurrence of all tag out requirements necessary to safely perform work.
Job Requirements:
Minimum 3-5 years practical welding experience, preferably within the marine and/or shipyard industry.
Must demonstrate knowledge of general hand tools as well as those common to welders/fitters (grinders, die grinders, angle grinders, basic welding machines, etc.)
Must pass background and drug test

Job Purpose:
Completes construction projects through hands-on work, scheduling materials, sub-contractors, and personnel; monitoring progress; enforcing code and safety regulations; supervising staff and sub-contractors.

Duties:
* Accomplishes work requirements by orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, and coaching employees; supervising sub-contractors.

* Meets construction work standards by following production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving operational problems; identifying work process improvements.

* Meets construction budget by preparing estimates; monitoring expenses; implementing cost-saving actions.

* Monitors construction projects by confirming instructions for carpentry, plumbing, electrical, concrete, painting, and related trades; conducting inspections; issuing change orders; approving work.

* Maintains safe, secure, and healthy work environment by following and enforcing company standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations.

* Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.

Skills/Qualifications:
Verbal Communication, Project Management, Planning, Quality Management, Supply Management, Production Planning, Quality Focus
 Must have truck and tools.  Must pass pre-employment drug screening and background check.  Mileage reimbursement and benefits available.

Nation General Contractor in San Diego is looking for a Project Manager to add to their growing team.
They have a great pipeline of work starting in Q4 of 2018 and the begining of 2019.



Client Details

Our Client is a San DIego based General Construction. The company focuses in projects such as commercial, public works, retail, production, and education.

Description
Review all project plans/documents thoroughly
Meet with the Project Executive to review the project
Develop an independent (from estimating) project schedule with the Superintendent
Meet with the Client and/or Architect to clarify the project scope
Identify long lead items
Participate in the project kick-off and "box-pass" meetings
Review submittals
Issue "for construction" drawings
Work with the Superintendent to identify errors and omissions on plans, specifications, submittals and shop drawings
Select vendors, negotiate and award subcontracts and major purchases
Negotiate change orders
Insure all fees and permits are identified and paid or reimbursed by the Owner
Maintain the company's relationship with the project Architect and other consultants while encouraging other team members to develop and maintain these relationships ("be easy to do business with")
Be accountable for profitability, schedule compliance, field and office quality assurance, customer satisfaction and repeat business
Work closely with the Superintendent to insure the Superintendent understands and follows company policies and procedures
Maintain good relationships with the Client(s)
Manage Subcontractors
Work closely with the Superintendent and Client through the closeout phase
Process change orders
Approve invoices
Complete payment requests
Attend project meetings with Staff and Owners/Clients and document with meeting minutes
Control cost and budget and develop revenue and profit projections
Prepare for and attend monthly Job Cost Reviews per the Job Cost Review checklist
Assist Superintendent to insure adherence to all safety requirements


Profile

The Project Manager candidate located in San DIego should have adequate skills in the following areas:
Reading and understanding blueprints
A strong sense of urgency and drive to complete tasks
Strong leadership experience
Knowledge of construction techniques and proper scheduling of subcontractors work is essential
5-7 years of construction experience preferred
Extensive written and verbal communication skills
Must be comfortable working in a team environment
Must be able to complete tasks based on deadlines
Must be proficient in time management and multitasking
**A PLUS** Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Construction Management

Job Offer

This position in San Diego offers great benefits such as:

- Competitive Base Salary

- Health care

- Car allowance

- PTO and Vacation Days

Overview

Foreman: Position Summary

We believe there is a better, less expensive, cleaner way for families to power their homes. As a pioneer of solar-as-a-service model, we are truly saving the planet, one solar panel at a time. We have long-established relationships with some of the nation's largest and most trusted national retailers which provide us with a great platform for driving further awareness and brand recognition.

A career at Sunrun opens countless opportunities for you to sharpen your skills, push limits and uncover your potential. Sunrun services 23 states, with dual headquarters in San Francisco and Denver. Sunrun continues to rapidly expand as customer awareness and demand for solar increases. With this growth we have great career opportunities and upward mobility for highly motivated, success-minded Installation employees. Come join our exciting team at Sunrun!

Foreman will provide leadership and technical expertise for a solar installation crew. The Foreman is responsible for the safety, quality, customer service, and productivity of each assigned solar installation project. The Foreman is a working field position that leads a team of 3 to 6 members to successfully complete residential projects.

Join nearly 4,000 and growing Sunrunners on our mission to Create a Planet Run by the Sun!

Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for the successful installation of residential solar projects
Organize, lead, and train crew members to complete projects within established guidelines and timeframes
Ensure attention to detail with an emphasis on safety, quality, customer service, and productivity
Effectively manage all aspects of the construction workflow of the project to drive productivity
Ensure that there is adequate materials and equipment to safely and efficiently complete projects
Effectively maintain project documentation and photo requirements
Demonstrate knowledge of OSHA standards related to photovoltaic installations and enforce safety practices and standards
Check on progress of installers every hour throughout the installation to ensure the installation process; Follow construction job flow procedures
Develop a positive working dynamic within installation crew and branch co-workers; Analyze and resolve worker problems and recommend solutions; Maintain consistent and appropriate interface with customer throughout construction phase
Assist the crew on the roof as needed to ensure an efficient and high quality installation
Perform weekly vehicle inspection for proper tire pressures, oil level, working lights, etc.
Obtain customer payments and deliver to management as required
Ensure accuracy of your own and crew's time sheets
Provide construct-ability feedback to management
Maintain excellent lines of communication
Perform service calls when necessary
Additional duties assigned as needed


Qualifications

REQUIREMENTS (EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS, AND OTHER SKILLS)
Must have minimum of 2 years construction or roofing experience, including 1 year of solar installation experience, as well as leadership responsibilities
Knowledge of the NEC and applicable codes and standards. Carry and maintain up-to-date NEC code book
Ability to perform all installation duties of the Installer and Lead Installer
Have CPR and First Aid Certifications up to date and keep maintained for purposes of continued employment (class costs are reimbursable by the company)
Physically capable of performing work duties
Ability to communicate with customers in courteous and professional manner
Have a strong work ethic, high level of craftsmanship/workmanship with strong attention to detail
Basic computer knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word
Possess strong mechanical/construction skills
Have excellent verbal communication and documentation skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Have good people skills, able to manage, motivate and discipline when necessary
Experience with electrical work involving wiring up to 600 VDC and 480 VAC
State electrical certification/license preferred
Ability to drive a vehicle during the normal course of business. Must maintain a clean driving record with the ability to pass a driving background check. Must be 21 years of age and possess a valid driver's license
Ability to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements including a background check and drug screen


WORKING CONDITIONS AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Ability to transport materials and equipment to complete assigned job tasks (up to 50 pounds frequently and up to 100 pounds with assistance)
Ability to work on rooftops with various angles and surfaces which requires frequent bending, twisting, squatting, climbing, kneeling, crawling, turning, standing, and balance
Ability to work in confined spaces such as attics, basements, and crawl spaces which requires kneeling and crouching
Ability to work in outdoor weather conditions including but not limited to: excessive noise, extreme heat, extreme cold, wet environment, and humidity
Ability to frequently utilize hand functions requiring fine motor skills including but not limited to: fine manipulation, grasping, and pinching
Ability to work within the safe range of equipment such as ladders, fall protection harnesses and other personal protective equipment
Ability to work while wearing heavy protective equipment such as arc flash suits, gloves, and face shields
Ability to work and maintain balance on roofs and other areas of height
Ability to work in the sun and possibly low light conditions
Ability to walk on rafters, roof tiles, and roof shingles without damage
Ability to distinguish colors such as red, black, yellow, white, green
Ability to hear verbal commands and warnings
Ability to work with chemicals using appropriate protection


DISCLAIMER

This description indicates the general nature and level of the qualifications and duties required of employees in this job classification, as well as the essential functions a person must be able to perform to do this job. It is not designed to be a comprehensive inventory of all duties and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Sunrun Inc. and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and make employment decisions on the basis of merit and business need. We hire without consideration to race, color, religion, citizenship, political activity or affiliation, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, sex or gender, or any other basis protected by law.

RSRRUN

Scope of Position: The Project Administrative Assistant will be responsible for projects document control, support the on-site construction team on construction contracts compliance and daily on-site office management.
Location: Rancho Bernardo (interim) and Desert Center, CA
Responsibilities: The primary responsibilities of this position are:
• Controls project documents in project depository systems -database/Firmex, ECRM, Office 365, SmartSheet and/or Sharefile. Ensures that files are correct before uploading to all project depository systems.
• Create SAP purchase requisitions for the projects .
• Responsible for project meeting minutes, sharing them to attendees within 48 hours after each meeting for review.
• File daily POD’s, and other documentation as needed
• Update/track ALL equipment serial number tracking per Turbine location (delivery to commissioning and Hand-Over to O&M).
• Update/track RFI’s and report any RFI status – late, on schedule and/or critical prior to the weekly external and internal meetings.
• Update/track any internal or 3rd party inspection information.
• Update/track NCN’s relating to Site Activities. Summarize NCNs in a report prior to weekly external and internal meetings.
• Update/monitor/track specific binders for all installed equipment’s (Turbine; Transformers; Met Masts, etc.).
• Update/Track Punch List items up to Substantial Completion.
• Monitor/track site Visitors/Vendors through sign-in sheet.
• Monitor/track all site PSE/Safety supplies (EDF issued hard hats, glasses, vests, etc.)
• Monitor/track all site office supplies, including EDF issued equipment, i.e. printers, etc., order any office supplies through Project Admin. Coordinator, Allison Ramirez
• Answer phones and keep tracking records of faxes, mail, handoffs.
• Ship and/or receive UPS packages as needed
• File set up for all Turbines, O&M building, Met Masts, Substation, … (computer and/or paperwork files)
• Responsible for Monthly meeting set up – organization, issue agenda and reports 2 days in advance, take meeting minutes/notes, lunch coordination, etc.
• Overall provide assistance to all site TEAM members
 Qualifications:
• Construction management and/or Administrative experience
• Technology skills
• Strong communication
• Organizational ability
• Capability to document and report on site specific activities
• Written expression
• Time management
• Technical over site
• Customer service skills
• Ability to lead by example
• Problem solving skills
• Planning skills
 Working Conditions:
100% of the time is spent in San Diego corporate office from September 2018 through July 2019. 100% of the time at Desert Center, CA, project construction site starting July 2019 through December 2020. The project site is a commercial/industrial construction environment utilizing computers and construction documentation such as plans, specifications, contracts, schedules and other project control documents.
This temporary position from 2018 to 2020. Potentially can extend to December 2021.

Time off Benefits including: Vacation, Sick, and Holiday
Tuition Reimbursement......and many more

Our team is made up of full and part time employees. These roles are permanent positions that play a critical role in delivering Ricoh's services and solutions to our customers. Ricoh offers positions with a developmental path and a range of training resources to meet our employees' needs. From on-boarding training to continued development for all of our employees, we provide many resources to set our employees up for continued success.

Ricoh works to motivate employees with competitive pay and benefits that are affordable. We offer proven career paths - locally, regionally, and nationally.

WE ARE RICOH! Apply today!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

POSITION PROFILE

Supervises day-to day operations and staff of MS sites. 80% of time should be spent in managing duties, no more than 20% in operating production equipment. Develops, implements and reviews related procedures. Invoices accounts and interacts with customer; assists in maintaining acceptable profit levels and ensures that customer expectations are met. High degree of customer interface. Responsible for 3 - 6 employees or up to $50K in services revenue per month at a single site.

JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Routinely demonstrates and creates a helpful and positive work culture.
Encourages and builds positive relationships and communicates effectively with all co-workers and outside vendors.
Conducts themselves at all times as the public image of the company in accordance with RICOH's code of ethics.
Effective implementation of RICOH Service Excellence. Effective implementation and management of RICOH Service Excellence.
Achieves shift profitability in the area of cost of goods by effectively supervising the shift in the use of company materials and supplies.
Manages total production labor percentages by achieving percentage of production worker labor and quality control labor established by the company.
Meets quality and deadline standards by the effective use of job scheduling practices.
Handles formal contact with the customer on a daily basis in MS and as needed in BDS/LDS.
Provides training on work flow and machine operations when necessary.
Ensures the quality of operations for shift by assisting in the achievement of goals in Audit and Deadline compliance.
Increases employee retention by achieving turnover and average tenure goals.
Maintains efficient workflow by holding direct reports accountable for quality and efficiency of their work.
Ensures that location is properly staffed by matching employee skills and equipment with production demands.
Facilities resolution of issues concerning pricing, orders-in and invoicing by interacting and communicating with sales department.
Motivates employees and recognizes their accomplishments in a timely manner.
Clearly communicates job expectations/consequences of employees by training, cross-training, coaching, counseling, directing, evaluating the work of subordinates to increase their work output and work quality.
Completes site reports and other paperwork as necessary.
Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Experience, and Certifications)

Typically Required:


High school or GED is required.
3+ years experience in a related field is required.
Experience in delivering classroom and/or informal training sessions are required.
Experience in operation of the most advanced machines, performing complex jobs, is required.

Ricoh is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer -- Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled.

column2: Facilities Technician I / Rail Operator / Field Technician
column5:
Job Title:  Facilities Technician I / Rail Operator
Location:  San Diego, CA 
Duration:  1 Year to 4 Year
 Job Responsibilities:
Total of 12 tanker rail cars to be brought into the facility. He/she will operate on the rail cars to connect the hoses, fittings, pre and post inspection for each one
Record in a spreadsheet each rail car and the number of gallons daily
Physical work of the loading and unloading of the cars- 99% of the work is hooking up the hoses and disconnecting the hoses throughout the day. This person will be working with a handful of wrenches throughout the day
Perform routine preventive maintenance to ensure that machines continue to run smoothly, building systems operate efficiently, or the physical condition of buildings does not deteriorate.
Inspect drives, motors, and belts, check fluid levels, replace filters, or perform other maintenance actions, following checklists.
Use tools ranging from common hand and power tools, such as hammers, hoists, saws, drills, and wrenches (primary responsibility), to precision measuring instruments and electrical and electronic testing devices.
Assemble, install or repair wiring, electrical and electronic components, pipe systems and plumbing, machinery, and equipment.
Inspect, operate, and test machinery and equipment to diagnose machine malfunctions.
Dismantle devices to access and remove defective parts, using hoists, cranes, hand tools, and power tools.
 Job Requirements:
Able to climb ladders and work on top of railcars at a height to of 16 feet.
Able to remove access ways between railcars at heights of 16 feet.
Able to lift 50 lbs. on a regular basis.
Able to work in close quarters.
Work in all weather conditions; heat, cold, rain, etc.
Must have a mechanical aptitude and dexterity in the use of tools and equipment.
Ability to follow safety and process standards within an Industrial Setting
With training and guidance, will perform transfer operations handling hazardous materials.
Must be able to work independently at times and possess a strong work ethic
Must demonstrate a strong commitment to personal and job safety
Will be able to complete checklists and computer spreadsheets
Must be able to perform basic mathematical calculations and possess basic computer skills including spreadsheet and word processing applications.
Must have good verbal/written communication skills
High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent is required
 Preferred qualifications:
Familiar with loading / unloading operations (tank, marine and or rail)
Experience in the petroleum or energy industry
Military experience a plus

Join one of the Top Growing General Contractors in the San Diego Area. They have the area's most high profile projects and an Awesome company Culture.
Led by some the most highly successful industry veterans this opportunity will offer Top Compensation and benefits and excellent growth opportunities.
The Senior Project Manager is responsible for planning, organizing, and controlling of a project.
The Senior Project Manager will supervise a project team
Job Responsibilities includes (but may not be limited to):
Sets safety, quality, schedule, cost and owner relationship goals.
Provides input and supervises all pre-construction services such as purchase orders, subcontracts, schedules, job cost set-up, bid packages and project pre-planning.
Works with the VP of Operations to obtain the personnel resources required to properly staff the project.
100% Detailed/hands-on knowledge of Project Scope.
Reviews project proposal or plans to determine time frame, procedures for accomplishing project, staffing requirements and allotment of available resources to various phases of the project.
Manages the financial aspects of contracts; assures job margin analysis is completed on a regular basis.
Develops baseline project schedule with assistance from Superintendent and/or VP of Operations.
Monitors and reports project cost and schedule performance; recommends corrective actions if needed
Proactively identify changes in work scope and ensure appropriate planning measures are taken with internal and external project team members to reassess and amend the scope of work requirement and timeline.
Analyze and resolve issues that have the potential to jeopardize the ability to meet agreed upon deliverables.
Reviews change orders for accuracy.
Reviews and takes action on contractor pay requests and invoicing.
Reviews status reports prepared by project personnel and modifies schedules or plans as required; prepares project reports
Manages claims; identifies and resolves potential claims with subcontractors/suppliers.
Participates in project coordination meetings.
Ensures adherence to insurance, safety, labor relations, EEO and tax regulations.
Monitors and ensures quality control.
Works with Safety Director to ensure jobs have safe working conditions and safe work practices are in place.
Establishes and maintains positive relationships with key owners and architects.
Accountable for project completion and financials, Critical Success Factors, Customer Satisfaction Results.
Directs and ensures timely completion of project close-out activities.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, or related field.
Strong experience in project management for the construction industry.
Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite, Project Management software (Viewpoint or similar) and Scheduling software (Primavera or similar).
Extensive knowledge of construction methods and materials, costing, scheduling and estimating.
Demonstrated ability to lead people and get results through others.
Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.
Problem analysis and problem resolution at both a strategic and functional level.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

SDC & Associates, Inc. is a Construction Consulting/Management Firm, specializing in Claims Preparation and Construction Education. We price and negotiate Change Orders and Claims. We prepare C.P.M. Schedules and Time Extension Analyses, including delay/disruption and impact costs. We provide Construction Management services on a full-time or part-time basis. We present cases to Mediation, Arbitration and Dispute Resolution Boards. We provide Litigation Support, including expert witness and Forensic Causes and Origin. We also provide Project Management Training, and Construction Training through Public and In-House Seminars.

Position Information:

PURPOSE: Preparation of the Request for Equitable Adjustment and/or claim for clients.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION: This person must be able to communicate to clients in a professional manner, and have an overall basic knowledge of construction or finance.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Financial and/or construction Background a plus; strong working knowledge of Word, Excel & Outlook; communication skills both verbal and written; ability to multi-task; and ability to be a part of a team.
 ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
* Provide administrative support to Claims Department
* Enter data for each of the issues in developed format
* Strong computer skills, especially in Excel and Word
* Having good writing skills
* Prepare costs and write narrative of the submitted costs
* Prepare list of exhibits
* Write faxes or send E-mails to clients about missing information
* Ability to work on several projects at a time
* Prepare accurate timesheets daily
* Ability to work independently and as part of the team
* Self-starter
* Ability to ask questions
* Knowledge of all office equipment and company policies and procedures
* Complete knowledge of all procedures relating to the company’s clients

Overview

Foreman: Position Summary

We believe there is a better, less expensive, cleaner way for families to power their homes. As a pioneer of solar-as-a-service model, we are truly saving the planet, one solar panel at a time. We have long-established relationships with some of the nation's largest and most trusted national retailers which provide us with a great platform for driving further awareness and brand recognition.

A career at Sunrun opens countless opportunities for you to sharpen your skills, push limits and uncover your potential. Sunrun services 23 states, with dual headquarters in San Francisco and Denver. Sunrun continues to rapidly expand as customer awareness and demand for solar increases. With this growth we have great career opportunities and upward mobility for highly motivated, success-minded Installation employees. Come join our exciting team at Sunrun!

Foreman will provide leadership and technical expertise for a solar installation crew. The Foreman is responsible for the safety, quality, customer service, and productivity of each assigned solar installation project. The Foreman is a working field position that leads a team of 3 to 6 members to successfully complete residential projects.

Join nearly 4,000 and growing Sunrunners on our mission to Create a Planet Run by the Sun!

Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for the successful installation of residential solar projects
Organize, lead, and train crew members to complete projects within established guidelines and timeframes
Ensure attention to detail with an emphasis on safety, quality, customer service, and productivity
Effectively manage all aspects of the construction workflow of the project to drive productivity
Ensure that there is adequate materials and equipment to safely and efficiently complete projects
Effectively maintain project documentation and photo requirements
Demonstrate knowledge of OSHA standards related to photovoltaic installations and enforce safety practices and standards
Check on progress of installers every hour throughout the installation to ensure the installation process; Follow construction job flow procedures
Develop a positive working dynamic within installation crew and branch co-workers; Analyze and resolve worker problems and recommend solutions; Maintain consistent and appropriate interface with customer throughout construction phase
Assist the crew on the roof as needed to ensure an efficient and high quality installation
Perform weekly vehicle inspection for proper tire pressures, oil level, working lights, etc.
Obtain customer payments and deliver to management as required
Ensure accuracy of your own and crew's time sheets
Provide construct-ability feedback to management
Maintain excellent lines of communication
Perform service calls when necessary
Additional duties assigned as needed


Qualifications

REQUIREMENTS (EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS, AND OTHER SKILLS)
Must have minimum of 2 years construction or roofing experience, including 1 year of solar installation experience, as well as leadership responsibilities
Knowledge of the NEC and applicable codes and standards. Carry and maintain up-to-date NEC code book
Ability to perform all installation duties of the Installer and Lead Installer
Have CPR and First Aid Certifications up to date and keep maintained for purposes of continued employment (class costs are reimbursable by the company)
Physically capable of performing work duties
Ability to communicate with customers in courteous and professional manner
Have a strong work ethic, high level of craftsmanship/workmanship with strong attention to detail
Basic computer knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word
Possess strong mechanical/construction skills
Have excellent verbal communication and documentation skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Have good people skills, able to manage, motivate and discipline when necessary
Experience with electrical work involving wiring up to 600 VDC and 480 VAC
State electrical certification/license preferred
Ability to drive a vehicle during the normal course of business. Must maintain a clean driving record with the ability to pass a driving background check. Must be 21 years of age and possess a valid driver's license
Ability to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements including a background check and drug screen


WORKING CONDITIONS AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Ability to transport materials and equipment to complete assigned job tasks (up to 50 pounds frequently and up to 100 pounds with assistance)
Ability to work on rooftops with various angles and surfaces which requires frequent bending, twisting, squatting, climbing, kneeling, crawling, turning, standing, and balance
Ability to work in confined spaces such as attics, basements, and crawl spaces which requires kneeling and crouching
Ability to work in outdoor weather conditions including but not limited to: excessive noise, extreme heat, extreme cold, wet environment, and humidity
Ability to frequently utilize hand functions requiring fine motor skills including but not limited to: fine manipulation, grasping, and pinching
Ability to work within the safe range of equipment such as ladders, fall protection harnesses and other personal protective equipment
Ability to work while wearing heavy protective equipment such as arc flash suits, gloves, and face shields
Ability to work and maintain balance on roofs and other areas of height
Ability to work in the sun and possibly low light conditions
Ability to walk on rafters, roof tiles, and roof shingles without damage
Ability to distinguish colors such as red, black, yellow, white, green
Ability to hear verbal commands and warnings
Ability to work with chemicals using appropriate protection


DISCLAIMER

This description indicates the general nature and level of the qualifications and duties required of employees in this job classification, as well as the essential functions a person must be able to perform to do this job. It is not designed to be a comprehensive inventory of all duties and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Sunrun Inc. and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and make employment decisions on the basis of merit and business need. We hire without consideration to race, color, religion, citizenship, political activity or affiliation, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, sex or gender, or any other basis protected by law.

RSRRUN

POSITION PROFILE

Supervises day-to day operations and staff of MS sites. 80% of time should be spent in managing duties, no more than 20% in operating production equipment. Develops, implements and reviews related procedures. Invoices accounts and interacts with customer; assists in maintaining acceptable profit levels and ensures that customer expectations are met. High degree of customer interface. Responsible for 3 - 6 employees or up to $50K in services revenue per month at a single site.

JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Routinely demonstrates and creates a helpful and positive work culture.
Encourages and builds positive relationships and communicates effectively with all co-workers and outside vendors.
Conducts themselves at all times as the public image of the company in accordance with RICOH's code of ethics.
Effective implementation of RICOH Service Excellence. Effective implementation and management of RICOH Service Excellence.
Achieves shift profitability in the area of cost of goods by effectively supervising the shift in the use of company materials and supplies.
Manages total production labor percentages by achieving percentage of production worker labor and quality control labor established by the company.
Meets quality and deadline standards by the effective use of job scheduling practices.
Handles formal contact with the customer on a daily basis in MS and as needed in BDS/LDS.
Provides training on work flow and machine operations when necessary.
Ensures the quality of operations for shift by assisting in the achievement of goals in Audit and Deadline compliance.
Increases employee retention by achieving turnover and average tenure goals.
Maintains efficient workflow by holding direct reports accountable for quality and efficiency of their work.
Ensures that location is properly staffed by matching employee skills and equipment with production demands.
Facilities resolution of issues concerning pricing, orders-in and invoicing by interacting and communicating with sales department.
Motivates employees and recognizes their accomplishments in a timely manner.
Clearly communicates job expectations/consequences of employees by training, cross-training, coaching, counseling, directing, evaluating the work of subordinates to increase their work output and work quality.
Completes site reports and other paperwork as necessary.
Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Experience, and Certifications)

Typically Required:


High school or GED is required.
3+ years experience in a related field is required.
Experience in delivering classroom and/or informal training sessions are required.
Experience in operation of the most advanced machines, performing complex jobs, is required.

Ricoh is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer -- Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled.

San Diego based General Contractor is seeking a qualified Sr. Superintendent

Strong pipeline ahead with additional plans for expansion

Client Details

A San Diego based General Contractor is urgently seeking a long term Construction Superintendent to manage a pipeline of projects including commercial, mixed-use, mid-rise and high-rise buildings, typically valued above $30MM.

Description
Ensure safe practices are used in the execution of project work
Assist with the development and communication of the project plan to include the project schedule, site logistics, safety and quality programs
Coordinate the work of multiple subcontractors and lead subcontractor coordination meetings on a regular basis
Conduct planning and maintenance of shutdowns and tie-ins
Assure all work is installed in accordance with the contract documents
Assist in resolving construction issues to maintain productivity of subcontractors
Experience working in occupied buildings
Experience and proficiency in all divisions of work, methods, materials, scheduling, and cost control

Profile
Bachelors or Associates degree in Construction Management or related field (highlt preferred)
10+ years of experience in managing commercial or multi-family projects; (Ground up experience is preferred)
Strong experience with Microsoft Office products and Microsoft Project or equivalent software
Ability to prepare and review scopes, RFI's and submittals
Ability to review and understand all construction documents including building plans and specifications
Experience with a fast paced project(s) and ability to maintain on time and on budget

Job Offer
Competitive based salary
Full benefits package
Industry leading company offering excellent stability and pipeline of projects
Opportunity for growth
Company Vehicle
Gas Card
Per Diem pay

San Diego, CA


Join one of the Top Growing General Contractors in the San Diego Area. They have the area's most high profile projects and an Awesome company Culture.
Led by some the most highly successful industry veterans this opportunity will offer Top Compensation and benefits and excellent growth opportunities.
The Senior Project Manager is responsible for planning, organizing, and controlling of a project.
The Senior Project Manager will supervise a project team
Job Responsibilities includes (but may not be limited to):
Sets safety, quality, schedule, cost and owner relationship goals.
Provides input and supervises all pre-construction services such as purchase orders, subcontracts, schedules, job cost set-up, bid packages and project pre-planning.
Works with the VP of Operations to obtain the personnel resources required to properly staff the project.
100% Detailed/hands-on knowledge of Project Scope.
Reviews project proposal or plans to determine time frame, procedures for accomplishing project, staffing requirements and allotment of available resources to various phases of the project.
Manages the financial aspects of contracts; assures job margin analysis is completed on a regular basis.
Develops baseline project schedule with assistance from Superintendent and/or VP of Operations.
Monitors and reports project cost and schedule performance; recommends corrective actions if needed
Proactively identify changes in work scope and ensure appropriate planning measures are taken with internal and external project team members to reassess and amend the scope of work requirement and timeline.
Analyze and resolve issues that have the potential to jeopardize the ability to meet agreed upon deliverables.
Reviews change orders for accuracy.
Reviews and takes action on contractor pay requests and invoicing.
Reviews status reports prepared by project personnel and modifies schedules or plans as required; prepares project reports
Manages claims; identifies and resolves potential claims with subcontractors/suppliers.
Participates in project coordination meetings.
Ensures adherence to insurance, safety, labor relations, EEO and tax regulations.
Monitors and ensures quality control.
Works with Safety Director to ensure jobs have safe working conditions and safe work practices are in place.
Establishes and maintains positive relationships with key owners and architects.
Accountable for project completion and financials, Critical Success Factors, Customer Satisfaction Results.
Directs and ensures timely completion of project close-out activities.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, or related field.
Strong experience in project management for the construction industry.
Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite, Project Management software (Viewpoint or similar) and Scheduling software (Primavera or similar).
Extensive knowledge of construction methods and materials, costing, scheduling and estimating.
Demonstrated ability to lead people and get results through others.
Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.
Problem analysis and problem resolution at both a strategic and functional level.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Keywords: Construction Project Manager, Project Manager in San Diego, Project Manager SD, Commercial Construction Project Manager, Southern California Construction Project Manager, Mixed Use Project Manager, K-12 Project Manager, DSA Project Manager, OSHPD Project Manager, Multi Family Project Manager, MOB Project Manger, Corporate Office Construction Project Manager, Ground up Construction Project Manager, TI Project Manager

POSITION PROFILE

Supervises the day-to-day operations of a 1-3 person site within a legal office environment. Supervisor reports directly to the Account Manager. Develops, implements, and reviews procedures for compliance and improvement. Telephone etiquette and skill is needed to interact with the Executive Level Customers. Creates, validates, and invoices client(s) as per the customers billing needs. Responsible for maintaining an acceptable profit level within the site.

LEGAL ENVIRONMENT RESPONSIBILITIES

Possess the legal background to understand Client Matter work flow, such as: 


Charge back to firm and/or clients with work/supplies/ hours, etc
Familiar with charge back systems (examples: Copitrak/Equitrac, etc)
Familiar with processes of closing binder, understanding depositions, knowledge of court systems and how items are delivered within the court system
Assists with scheduling equipment, labor, and supplies for offsite trial(s)

 DAILY OFFICE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Responsible for effective implementation and management of RICOH Service Excellence.
Functions as a document specialist or other operations worker.
Handles formal contact with the customer on a daily basis.
Handles highly sensitive and confidential documents that may be time sensitive.
Provides quality work due to the sensitive nature of documents and projects that are required in a legal environment.
Responsible for interacting and providing professional support to firm associates (legal secretaries, project managers, paralegals, associates, and partners).
Performs accurate jobs/projects that may require tight deadlines and potentially under high pressure.
Provides training on workflow and machine operations when necessary.
Ensures payroll accuracy by overseeing and correcting all time clock punches.
Achieves shift profitability (cost of goods) by effectively supervising the labor, materials, and supplies.
Operates shifts and maintains quality of work to comply with audits and deadlines.
Meets quality and deadline standards by the effective use of job scheduling practices.
Maintains efficient workflow by holding direct reports accountable for quality and efficiency of their work.
Facilitates resolution of issues concerning pricing, orders-in and invoicing by interacting and communicating with Ricoh sales department.
Ensures all direct reports execute objectives by the use of a developmental plan/ninety (90) day plan and regular performance reviews; posting productivity, quality, and deadline results.
Maintains positive internal working relationships with all department employees by communicating in a professional manner.
Completes site reports and other paperwork on time and accurately.
Completes month-end management report.
Possesses ability to manage financial results by interpreting, projecting, managing declining balances, and reconciling profit and loss statement.
Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS (Education, Experience, and Certifications)


Typically Requires:
Requires high school diploma or GED and 2+ years of experience in a related field.
Minimum of 2 years experience in the legal industry is strongly preferred
Requires experience in delivering classroom and/or informal training sessions.
Requires experience in operation of the most advanced machines, performing complex jobs.
Requires experience in setting goals by defining and prioritizing specific, realistic objectives.

column2: Project Land Surveyor - AutoCAD, Office Surveying - #1 Firm!

Based in Poway, CA we are recognized as one of the top civil engineering and land surveying agencies in California! We have been a profitable business for nearly 3 decades providing engineering services to Southern CA's top Clients! We are experiencing some incredible growth with new Client acquisitions from big names like Nike and Google! This is an incredible opportunity for you to lead and mentor a survey team in San Mateo and work with a laid back fun loving group of people! You will be working with dynamic teams of professionals who are passionate about their careers as much as they are about the Clients we work with. We have an immediate need for a Project Land Surveyor with 5+ years of experience! So if this is the fresh new change you are looking for, then please apply!
What's In It for You
- Excellent Compensation!
- Growing Company!
- Complete Benefits! (Medical/Dental/Vision/Life)
- 100% Employer PAID HMO!
- 401(k)!
- Generous PTO!
- Full Week Off Every Year Before New Years!
- Flexible Schedule!
- Half Day Fridays!
What You Will Be Doing
Site control; boundary reconnaissance; construction staking; topographic surveys; and other surveying services in support of engineering work. You may also assist with preparing field notes and exhibits; reviewing field notes for completeness and clarity; performing construction staking calculations for improvements and utilities; scheduling, budgeting, and client/contractor interaction for surveying projects.
What You Need for this Position
Bachelor's Degree in Construction, Engineering or Similar (preferred) w/
- 5+ years of office surveying experience
- Project management experience
- Proficiency in the use of AutoCAD
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Excellent customer service skills with an ability to interact professionally and knowledgeably with clients.
- Possession of an active California Land Surveyors license (DESIRABLE)
So, if you are a Project Land Surveyor looking for a fresh new change, please apply today!

column2: Sales Exec - Fire Sprinkler Sales (New Construction)
column5:
If you are a Sales Professional with experience selling Fire Sprinkler New Construction Contracts, please read on.

With a team of over 300 employees, we are a highly competitive fire protection company that assists with the full-service cycle construction of fire suppression and life safety systems. From the design and build processes to the actual engineering and constriction processes; we install fire protection systems, fire extinguishers, fire sprinklers and much more. Our work can be found in some of the largest airports, hospitals, business centers and sports complexes throughout California and we are looking for Fire Sprinkler Sales Executive for our San Diego, CA branch.
What's In It for You
- $60k-$80k/year
- Commission plan
- Medical, Dental, Vision, Supplemental Life & Long Term Disability
- Life Insurance, AD&D, Long Term Disability
- Vacation and Sick days
- 8 Holidays off
Top Reasons to Work with Us
You'll be working for a highly competitive fire protection company that is well established in the industry and works on high-profile projects. We're a forward thinking company that provides its employees with the opportunity to work with cutting edge tools at a great facility.

Apply Now
Business Unit UTC Aerospace SystemsReq ID 72929BRDate posted 09/17/2018City Chula VistaState/Province California
When the global aerospace community looks for ideas and solutions to its biggest challenges, they turn to the people of UTC Aerospace Systems. We design, invent and deliver the most advanced and diverse range of aerospace systems on the market. We are inventors. We are manufacturers. We work in space exploration, commercial air travel, defense and rescue applications. Always learning and pushing the boundaries, we are an undisputed industry leader that continually sets the bar higher and higher. Come soar with us.

At UTC Aerospace Systems, we believe that innovation starts with our people. That’s why we have over 8,000 engineers located in 70 sites around the globe, across 14 countries. But our Engineering organization is not just a collection of individual businesses. We use our size and expertise to create system solutions that work across all our product lines.

Our industry-leading experts are setting the standards for the aerospace industry and paving the way for the future. But as new challenges present themselves, we need fresh, creative and motivated minds to overcome these hurdles, help us break barriers and achieve new levels of innovation. Do you have what it takes to join a global, diverse organization that doesn’t shy away from big opportunities? If so, we invite you to join our Engineering ranks and create the next generation of aerospace technologies. Together, we will move the world forward!

Primary Responsibilities:
Perform structural analysis in support of composite and metallic nacelle and aerostructure components using standard analysis methods and finite element approaches.
Conduct design trades and final product configuration definitions considering safety, strength, weight, cost and producibility.
Generate reports suitable for transmittal to an airworthiness authority and external customers.
Work with both domestic and global engineering support teams on technical aspects of the stress analysis activities.
Participate in continuous improvement activities and events.

Qualification:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree with 4-7+ years experience or
Master's degree with 2-5+ years experience or
PhD degree with 0-2+ years experience.
Strong background in aerospace structural analysis (classical hand analysis and finite element skills).
Demonstrated understanding of structural load paths.
General knowledge of applicable regulatory requirements.
NASTRAN/PATRAN or equivalent FEA software experience.
Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills.
Knowledge and experience using MS Office products.
Ability to deliver high quality output in needed timeframes.
Work well in team environment.
Ability to adapt to changing situations.

Preferred Qualifications:
Nacelle stress analysis.
Advanced Excel knowledge.
• Experience working with international teams.

Education:
Bachelor's Degree in Structural, Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering

Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems has an opening for a Payloads Weapons Engineer 4 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This positionwill be located in San Diego, CA.


The Payloads Weapons Engineer 4 is expected to be a highly-motivated self-starter with the ability to define, design, integrate, and test Universal Armament Interface (UAI) compliant MIL-STD-1760 Stores Management Systems (SMS) and Bomb Rack Assemblies (BRA). Specific tasks performed in this role are requirements management, system integration, test plan development, and test execution of a weapon system throughout the entire development, demonstration, and production phases.


The successful candidate must possess in-depth technical knowledge of SMS/ Suspension and Release Equipment (S&RE)-related hardware and software requirements and experience in the definition, design, integration, test, and certification (end-to-end development) and operation of S&RE. The successful candidate must also possess intimate knowledge of governing standards to include UAI Platform-Store ICD, MIL-STD-1553, MIL-STD-1760, AS5653, etc., and must possess significant experience preparing detailed requirements specifications, statements of work, test plans and procedures, certification plans and procedures, performance reports, etc., related to these governing standards.


The successful candidate will be expected to thoroughly understand all system requirements, develop statements of work, specifications and interface control documents, prepare, monitor and update program schedules, conduct and participate in all related design reviews, and provide technical guidance to the cross-functional team.
Basic Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree in STEM(Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) related field.
Must have at least 9 years of Engineering experience or 7 years of Engineering with a Master's Degree or 4 years with a PHD.
Experience working with weapons and payload systems
Active DoD Secret clearance (within 4 year scope)
Ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret clearance as well as access to Special Programs


Preferred Qualifications:




Master'sin Engineering


Greater than 9 years of experience working with weapons and payload systems


In-depth knowledge of governing standards to include UAI Platform-Store ICD, MIL-STD-1553, MIL-STD-1760, AS5653


Technical Writing Skills (Presenting to Chief Engineer and Executives, Writing proposals)


Active Top Secret clearance with access to Special Programs


Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Job Description
The Operator – Heavy Equipment is responsible for the safe operation of heavy equipment at a recycling facility, landfill or transfer station for the purpose of transferring, spreading, covering, loading and/or compacting waste or soil in an efficient and safe manner.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
• Good customer services skills to meet and exceed customer expectations; acts in a professional, courteous and cooperative manner toward customers and co-workers; works with a sense of honesty and trustworthiness.
• Good time management skills to ensure assigned responsibilities are completed in an efficient and safe manner.
• Good follow through ability; ability to adhere to work schedule and follows through on challenges as they arise.
• Ability to adhere to Company policies and rules set forth; promotes the Company’s safety standards; does not take inappropriate risks.
• Maintains a feeling of pride in work; strives to achieve all goals.

Preferred Qualifications
• High School diploma or GED
• Two years’ prior related experience in heavy equipment operation.
• One year of prior experience working at sites regulated by OSHA.

Principal Responsibilities
• Perform pre- and post-operation inspection of the equipment in accordance with Company policy to ensure windows, lights, mirrors and rear view camera are clean. Safely and efficiently operate equipment that may include: forklift, excavator, bulldozer, front-end loader and other equipment using proper safety standards.
• Continuously monitor waste for evidence of unacceptable waste in materials.
• Continuously monitor the condition of the equipment to ensure it is operationally ready at all times to minimize down time; clean tracks or wheels on equipment, as needed.
• Perform and document minor service on equipment, referring more complicated mechanical issues to Maintenance Shop for repair.
• Complete Equipment Condition Report and other reports, as necessary; report any necessary repairs to supervisor, as needed.
• Follow all required safety policies and procedures.
• Ensure that shop is clean, serviced and stored at the completion of each shift.
• Perform other job-related duties as assigned. The statements used herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by an employee in this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required by an incumbent so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company.

• None.

• Comprehensive medical benefits coverage, dental plans and vision coverage.

• Life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment insurance.

• Employee discount programs.
• 401(k) plan with a generous company match.
• Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP).

Northrop Grumman has a need for a Life Cycle Cost & Engineering Analyst 4 to support our San Diego, CA CoE.


Essential Functions:

This technical, independent performer will be a primary interface for Engineering Competitive Analysis (ECA) team in Rancho Bernardo.


This independent performer will generate the required analyses of data to allow program leadership to make strategic decisions.


The analyses will include the integration of program cost model data with high level schedule data to support program milestones, proposal BOE development, and to improve competitive positioning and integration with the risks / opportunities register.


Duties will include as a min.: serving as the organization spokesperson on advanced projects and/or programs, utilization of ECA tools to perform analyses, visualization, and optimization of the program affordability balanced scorecard (BSC); and conduct what-if scenarios to include trade studies and new technology insertions.


Additionally, this team member will facilitate the sharing of cross program/mission technical and programmatic new initiatives.


Must have a technical background (STEM degree) with ability to lead a high performance cross-sector team.


Must be a skilled communicator, with excellent presentation abilities.


Must be able to independently assess complex problems, and to generate and implement action plans across geographically dispersed diverse team(s).


A technical background and commensurate experience in developing data-driven solutions for program and/or capture leadership and the ability to develop and present these solutions to internal/external executive leadership is required.
Basic Qualifications:


BS degree inSTEM field and at least 9 years of applied experience or 7 years with a Master's degree in STEM field

Interim Top Secret required to start

Able to obtain and maintain special program access

High level, complex project management experience

Top Secret with current program access

About this Position
Hughes Marino is an award-winning tenant representation firm that is transforming the commercial real estate industry. Based in California and 100% family owned, we are an exciting and growing company with offices across the nation. We exclusively represent tenants and end users of space the local businesses, corporations and nonprofit organizations that make California a great place to live and do business and we do it with an exceptional level of service and unmatched expertise that have made us a leader in our industry for over 25 years.
As our company continues to grow, we are seeking talented, motivated teammates who embody our ten core values. We pride ourselves on being one of the most award-winning companies, including #7 Best Small Workplace in the Nation, a Top 100 Best Workplace for Millennials and #4 Best Workplace in Southern California by Fortune Magazine, #2 Top Company Culture in the Nation by Entrepreneur Magazine, a Best Workplace by Inc. Magazine, #1 Best Place to Work by Los Angeles Business Journal, San Diego Business Journal, Orange County Business Journal and #1 Best Workplace in Washington State by Puget Sound Business Journal, among many others. Hughes Marino is like family, and we have a culture of collaboration, support, innovation, and fun!
We are looking for superstar team members who deliver excellence every day, proactively communicate with others, pursue growth and learning, and build lasting relationships based on trust. You must be character-first, high energy with grit and initiative, and want to be part of our exciting future. If this sounds like you, then we want to meet you and encourage you to apply!
For more information about our dynamic culture, please visit Hughes Marino's blog, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
Job Description
Hughes Marino Project Management, a division of Hughes Marino, Inc., is currently seeking a qualified teammate to join us as a Project Manager or Senior Project Manager.
This position is a salaried, full-time opportunity with full health benefits, generous vacation time, parking, 401k, FSA, and a fantastic culture.
This position will be based out of our stunning San Diego headquarters in the desirable Little Italy neighborhood of downtown San Diego.
Duties will include, but not be limited to, interfacing with Hughes Marino brokers and clients, working with our planning and design team, estimating, scheduling, inspecting construction job progress, completing budgets, reviewing construction documents and reviewing and providing comments to leases.
If you are an incredibly organized person with a passion for construction management and want to thrive in a fast-paced environment, we offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and a long-term career opportunity as a valued member of the Hughes Marino family.
Desired Skills and Experience
Applicants should be highly proficient in Blue Beam, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word and Microsoft Project.
Applicants should possess a strong tendency towards leadership and an ability to manage teams through the design, permitting, bidding, construction and closeout process to a successful conclusion.
Experience with tenant improvement projects is preferred.
LEED accreditation is preferred.
Qualifications
The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3, but preferably 5-10 years of experience in the construction industry. We are looking for candidates who have served in Construction Project Manager type roles.
Bachelor's degree from a four-year college required, preferably in a related field.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, polished and a proud representative of the Hughes Marino brand.

National Community Renaissance (CORE) is seeking a Construction Superintendent to join our Construction team. CORE is one of the nation's largest non-profit affordable housing developers with a 20-year track record in community revitalization. We transform the economic and social future of communities by building quality, affordable housing combined with best practice social services to improve the self-sufficiency of our residents.
National Community Renaissance C.O.R.E. Values:
COMMUNITY - Through our high-quality construction and social services, we build great communities where our residents and neighbors can thrive.
OPTIMISM - We believe in the ability of people to strive for better lives, and we help provide them with the means to achieve their dreams.
RESPECT - We serve our residents, partners, and employees with utmost respect.
EXCELLENCE - We strive for the highest standards in design, construction, property management, and customer service.
Benefit Summary:
National Community Renaissance offers a comprehensive benefit package including, medical, dental, vision, 401(k) plan with match, Life Insurance, LTD, FSA, paid holidays, vacation, and sick time.
About the Job:
The Construction Superintendent reports to the VP of Construction and manages all aspects of construction at the assigned project site. Primary responsibilities include working directly with the Construction Manager and the VP of Construction to derive and define scopes of work, track the project budget and maintain the project timeline.
RESPONSIBILITIES
On site, the Superintendent coordinates all subcontractors and oversees the day-to-day activities of construction, including scheduling, inspections, quality control, safety, monitoring of construction budgets, and accountability for all related expenditures.
Work closely with Project Management for utilities, permits, plan checks, and Certificates of Occupancy to obtain all necessary approvals.
Direct subcontractors and subordinates.
Provide periodic written reporting and scheduling updates.
Evaluate situations and render decisions on certain issues without immediate supervision.
Understand and implement OSHA safety requirements site wide.
Knowledgeable of SWPPP requirements site wide and mitigate any impact to the outlying community.
Maintain a safe and compliant work site on a daily basis.
Relate favorably with others beyond giving and receiving instructions; performs work activities requiring negotiating, instructing, supervising, persuading or speaking with others and responding appropriately.
Effectively influences people on a consistent basis.
Make generalizations, evaluations or decisions without immediate supervision.
Accept and carry out responsibility for direction, control, and planning.
Must attend company sponsored events that relate to the development of the team, which, from time to time, may include overnight stays at locations away from the employee's home.
EXPERIENCE
Minimum ten years overall experience in construction supervision.
5-7 years of experience in the construction of affordable multi-family residential projects.
Experience working with city and other inspectors on construction projects.
Be proficient in Microsoft word, Excel, Outlook and Project software.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
Demonstrate a professional demeanor.
Higher education or technical training a plus.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORK ENVIRONMENT
Exposure to various types of weather conditions
Standing, walking
Pushing, pulling
Crawling, kneeling
Twisting, carrying
Working with hands
Driving - must have valid driver's license and current automobile insurance.
Operate computer and office equipment

It all began with a ROAR over 100 years ago!PRIMAY PURPOSE

The Life Support Systems Construction and Maintenance Lead Worker performs all job assignments with a positive attitude that reflects San Diego Zoo Global’s mission and vision of saving species worldwide by uniting our expertise in animcal care and conservation science with our dedication to inspiring passion for nature and leading the fight against extinction. The Life Support Systems Construction and Maintenance Lead worker is responsible for proper management and maintenance of life support systems required to maintain the assigned marine collection at San Diego Zoo Global (SDZG). This position reports to the Construction & Maintenance Supervisor or Manager.

Construction Project Manager

SUMMARY/COMPANY INFO
 Haley and Aldrich Construction Services is one of the leading engineering and construction services firms in the country.  We are problem solvers who adapt to construction uncertainties to safely deliver the value we promise.   We are known for establishing creative partnerships with stakeholders and clients to develop innovative and effective approaches to delivering projects that everyone considers a success.
 
Our Construction Project Managers at Haley & Aldrich have the opportunity to work on unique projects, work with diverse project teams and be an integral part of a growing market sector within Haley & Aldrich.   We are seeking a r Project Manager to join us in our Construction division and will be housed out of either our San Diego, CA  or our Phoenix, AZ office.     

This position reports to the Director of Operations.  The Project Manager is the first person assigned to the project from Operations and provides input / leads all discussions concerning schedule, cost and scope.  
 DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES   
The successful candidate will:
Provide demonstrated leadership in the area of safety.
Responsible for execution of mid to large and/or complex construction contracts, managing multiple staff, and overseeing large and/or complex sites/projects.
Responsible for delivering projects meeting required safety, quality control, budgets, and schedule in accordance with the contract and our internal processes. 
Works with the Business Development team to prepare detailed proposals for new and existing clients.
Works with the estimator to prepare detailed cost estimates for new and existing clients.
Responsible for working with Project Controls to create the cash flow schedule, schedule of values and the resource loaded project schedule.
Engages Procurement early in a buying function so as to assist in driving down cost.
Assists in project contract development with a focus on scope, cost and schedule.
Communicates directly with subcontractors and engineers concerning project cost, staffing, and scheduling.
Accountable for cost control and cost management for assigned projects including the client and subcontractor change management process.
Has overall responsibility for monitoring the accurate financial reporting of assigned projects, when applicable provides construction and financial oversight to Project Managers.
Reviews status and forward looking schedule and adherence to budget.
Evaluates and analyzes spending vs. schedule performance vs. budget
Acts as secondary liaison to Owner/Client and identifies opportunities to provide added value to Owner/Client experience.
Visits project sites on a regular interval and sequence. 
Reviews our team and our subcontractor performance progress, safety, and quality, coordinating between on-site needs and our internal processes
Responsible for on-site leadership for highest risk project activities. 
Assess personnel needs to stay on schedule. 
Alert Management as soon as possible if delays to schedule are expected.
Reviews project for proper documentation of Construction Quality Control, contractual liability, financial, safety issues and institutes corrective action(s) as required with the appropriate disciplines
Reports any schedule and budget variances to the Operations Manager. 
Liaison with, and updates progress to, Operations Manager.
Oversee and support the success of the Project Manager and the rest of the project team.
Provides support system to Project Team and ensures pathways to achievement of project goals.
Mentors direct reports and project staff to promote career development and successful project  execution.
Address personnel behavioral issues directly. 
Document and alert management via written communication.
Education/Expertise
Must have a Bachelor and/or Master degree in an Engineering or Construction discipline and a minimum of 5 years of construction experience in support of environmental or heavy civil construction projects.
Exceptional and effective communication skills (both written and verbal) and knowledge of the engineering, construction and commissioning phases of projects utilizing both design build and traditional project delivery platforms. 
Must possess a valid driver's license
Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen and background check.
About Haley & Aldrich
Haley & Aldrich is a nation-wide community, richly connected by networks of extraordinary people who seek to make the world a better place. We believe in creating potential through our people. If you are looking for an exciting opportunity where you can collaborate, fully engage, learn and put your expertise to work to handle important challenges, we want to talk with you!  We offer excellent career growth, a highly competitive total compensation plan and a solid benefits package that includes; health, dental, vision; Short-Term/Long-Term Disability; 401K with match; generous vacation plan and paid time off; tuition reimbursement; long-term care and more.  Interested candidates should apply online at http://www.haleyaldrich.com/join-us/open-positions.
  Haley & Aldrich is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, age, disability, veteran or any other legally protected status.

COMPANY OVERVIEW
Pattern Energy is an independent, fully integrated energy company that develops, constructs, owns and operates renewable energy projects and transmission assets across North America, Japan and parts of Latin America.  The company focuses primarily on wind, solar and transmission, with limited investments in other generation technologies.
The Pattern Energy team has a history as one of the top North American renewable energy and transmission providers in the industry. The team is dedicated to delivering the highest value for its customers, partners, financial supporters and the communities in which it works, while exhibiting a strong commitment to promoting environmental stewardship and corporate responsibility.
Pattern Energy operates in the United States, Canada, Japan, Mexico and Chile, with offices in San Francisco, Houston, San Diego, New York, Toronto, Santiago, Tokyo and Mexico City.  Pattern Energy Group LP's corporate headquarters are in San Francisco.

JOB PURPOSE
Provide technical support of development activities and project management overview of the construction of wind and solar farms across the United States, with support to other markets as necessary.  Provide due diligence review of all project construction related documents, contracts, and field work.
Key Accountabilities
The key responsibilities will include as a minimum the following in support of renewable projects:
Provide technical due diligence of wind generation projects during development phase.
Review construction documents for completeness and compliance with utility interconnect agreements, power purchase agreements, land lease agreements, environmental permits, and good industry practice.
Work with Pattern’s preconstruction and development groups in the development, solicitation and award of construction services for various projects.
Provide overview of interface with major equipment suppliers. Ensure division of responsibility is coordinated between various stakeholders, EPC contractor and turbine supplier.  Ensures schedule and delivery provisions of major equipment agreements are compatible with project needs and EPC contract documents.
Execute the construction of the projects; be accountable for the safety, quality, cost and schedule of the project. Serve as the lead negotiator for scope and schedule specifics of the project.
Provide overview of project interface with interconnect utility. Ensure documents and drawings required by interconnect and power purchase agreements are provided in a timely manner.  Review monthly progress report to utilities.
Participate in the management of third party technical engineering support of project work, particularly relating to the design and performance of major equipment.
Manage Independent Engineer’s review of active construction projects. Ensure timely approval of design documents and resolves technical issues relating to project design.  Review and comment on Independent Engineer’s due diligence reports for active construction projects as well as development opportunities.
Provide project interface with Pattern management and construction lenders. Furnish monthly reports and status updates as required.

Experience/Qualifications/Education
Educational Experience
Ten years progressive responsible experience in the power industry with significant wind energy experience.
Bachelor of Science degree in engineering or construction management is desired.
Demonstrated ability to complete multi-million dollar construction projects on schedule and within budget. Field experience desirable.
Additional Requirements
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to prioritize and resolve multiple issues on multiple projects under demanding schedule constraints.
Through understanding of construction contact concepts, language and terms.
Knowledge of basic engineering concepts. Familiarity with transmission and distribution equipment, overhead and underground cable installation, reactive power compensation equipment, and SCADA systems helpful.
Technical Skills
Facility with typical computer software (Microsoft Word, Excel, Project and PowerPoint).
Scheduling application experience a plus.
  Pattern Energy Group LP is an equal opportunity employer.
